sentence: for example, regulation q, which capped interest rates on deposits, hampered the ability of depository institutions to attract funding and thus to extend credit.
lenders developed new techniques for using credit information to determine underwriting standards, set interest rates, and manage their risks.

as i have already mentioned, the ongoing growth and development of the secondary mortgage market reinforced the effect of these innovations, giving mortgage lenders greater access to the capital markets, lowering transaction costs, and spreading risk more broadly.
